channel.title: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?
channel.description:
Okay, I know this sounds like I'm asking for too much, but I've searched for days and I can't find what I need.
I'm looking for a VERY CLEAN Client and Source to start my new 317 project. I need something that is VERY clean meaning there is no bullshit, no extra stuff, very stable, only the things I need to start off with. I don't want anything that already has quests, and a load of pointless stuff already coded. I just want something that has the basics, and nothing more.
I've searched the downloads section, and google for days. I've been downloading and trying out different sources. I thought I found the perfect source and I cleaned the whole thing out (took aprox. 17 hours of nonstop work) and come to find out that the source is not stable at all.
Can anyone help me find the perfect clean 317 source and client to start off my project? I already have cache editors, map editors, etc. I'm looking to start off a new type of server with better methods than what you see every day, I've been studying java for years and I know plenty of things that could be improved that I see every day in server development.
Anyone who helps me find the perfect starting base(s) will be included in credits.
Thanks!

item.title: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?
item.dc:creator: @Ceres Ceres
item.description:
@Ceres wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:22, topic:416126”][quote author=Ceres link=topic=518064.msg3764242#msg3764242 date=1317092807]

Hyperion by Graham, or the first PI released.

How is Hyperion a clean base? It may be stable but I checked it out and it looks messy as hell.
[/quote]
I didn’t read the title fully, and the paragraph… to much to read. My bad I meant that PI is a good base to start off for beginners.[/quote]

I’m not really a beginner but I see what you mean. I just can’t stand the way PI was put together, idk why… It just bothers me.

Read full topic

item.source: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?

item.title: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?
item.dc:creator: @Ceres Ceres
item.description:
@Ceres wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:19, topic:416126”]Thanks guys

My server release was 2 clients, 1 that loads the 317 Cache, and one that loads a 377 Cache. My server loads both, I gave optional in-case there were problems with the 317 they could revert to the 377 cache, which I had to do very often, since I downgraded my server a lot.[/quote]

Love your work spades, I’m making a very nice server out of it right now. I’ll be sure to give you credits, BTW there is 2 config folders in your source? Which files can I remove?

Read full topic
item.source: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?

item.title: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Thanks guys

My server release was 2 clients, 1 that loads the 317 Cache, and one that loads a 377 Cache. My server loads both, I gave optional in-case there were problems with the 317 they could revert to the 377 cache, which I had to do very often, since I downgraded my server a lot.

Read full topic
item.source: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?

item.title: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?
item.dc:creator: @Ceres Ceres
item.description:
@Ceres wrote:

[quote=“Pure Slay, post:17, topic:416126”][quote author=Ceres link=topic=518064.msg3764319#msg3764319 date=1317098728]
It’s not like anyone is gonna notice its a 377 cache if the sprites are 317. Also I was meaning the base source, you can use any client you want.
[/quote]

You said actual 317. No point in arguing, you don’t have a firm grasp on rsps to understand at the present time.[/quote]

It was never an argument until you turned it into one, and I’m pretty sure I have a firm grasp on rsps. And yes it does load 317 cache, if you look at the thread it clearly shows 2 different clients, one of them loading 317 cache, and the other loading a 377 cache. Besides this is my own thread, and everything was already solved before you got here. Also this is a help section, not argument wanted.

Read full topic

item.title: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“Ceres, post:14, topic:416126”][quote author=Pure Slay link=topic=518064.msg3764309#msg3764309 date=1317097925]

Arsenal is the way to go (y)

One of the most complex cores, but it’s not finished yet sadly

I’m telling you, Spades-Scape, its what you really want if you’re going to make something like old rs… An ACTUAL 317 heh. Thanks to SPADES, love ya bruh.

Actual 317 yet it’s using 377 cache. Figure that out.
[/quote]

Actually its not a 377 cache, there are 377 sprites available, but you do not have to use them. It’s 317 by default.[/quote]

There is no full released 317 cache. Don’t believe me, look at the data in the cache. It’s 377.

Read full topic

item.title: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?
item.dc:creator: @Ceres Ceres
item.description:
@Ceres wrote:

lostmyphat:

That was v1. He kept updating it on the same thread.

I’ve just found the perfect client and source for a brand new 317 project. Its very clean and stable, already has full tutorial coded, and its very nice. No extra shit like quests and that nonsense. If anyone needs the perfect base and client for a 317 server/project, use Spades-Scape. If you can’t find the thread or download, I’ll be glad to post links. THANKS!

Read full topic

item.source: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?

item.title: Cleanest and Most Stable Source for Brand New Project?
item.dc:creator: @Ceres Ceres
item.description:
@Ceres wrote:

[quote=“Coelho, post:5, topic:416126”][quote author=Ceres link=topic=518064.msg3764242#msg3764242 date=1317092807]

Hyperion by Graham, or the first PI released.

How is Hyperion a clean base? It may be stable but I checked it out and it looks messy as hell.
[/quote]
It is actually decently clean. It just has a lot of helpers of sorts for future expandability. The only reason anyone would think it isn’t clean is if they don’t know how to use it.

EDIT: I have to admit, however, I don’t like the way it does a lot of what it does. Compared to others though, it is amazing.[/quote]

Do you recommend any other clean and stable bases that are coded like the dodian base servers and not hyperion or project insanity? I’m not saying I want a dodian base, I just want something as stable as dodian, and very clean with no clutter, very light files.

Read full topic

EDIT: I have to admit, however, I don’t like the way it does a lot of what it does. Compared to others though, it is amazing.
